editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Large (ecclesial) Four Gospels with Delux Mahdar. Twentieth century. Red paper strip with number 9 inside. Image 3l: An account of Abuna Takla Haymanot and his disciples. Images 3r-5r: Introduction. Images 6l-8l: Canon tables and calculation of the lines of the four gospels, and connections between the four gospels. Images 8l-r: Table of Contents. Images: Four Gospels አርባዕቱ፡ ወንጌላት. Images 9r-42r: Gospel of Matthew, ወንጌል፡ ዘማቴዎስ፡. Rochus Zuurmond, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, volume 1, General Introduction, AF 27 (Wiesbaden: Steiner Verlag, 1989). Rochus Zuurmond, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice, part 3 – The Gospel of Matthew, AF 55 (Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, 2001). Image 43l: List of 48 miracles in the book of Matthew. Images 43r-64r: Gospel of Mark, ወንጌል፡ ዘማርቆስ፡. Rochus Zuurmond, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice, the Synoptic Gospels, volume 2, The Gospel of Mark, AF 27 (Wiesbaden: Steiner Verlag, 1989). Image 65l: List of the 83 miracles in the book of Mark. Images 66r-103r: Gospel of Luke, ወንጌል፡ ዘሉቃስ፡. Image 104l: List of the sections of the book of Luke. Images 105r-133l: Gospel of John, ወንጌል፡ ዘዮሐንስ፡. Michael G. Wechsler, Evangelium Iohannis Aethiopicum, CSCO 617; SA 109 (Louvain: Peeters, 2005). Image 1r: pen trial. Image 133l: Colophon mentioning the year [19]43 [EC], Ḫədar, and the scribe, ገብረ ስንበት. There is also a notice of gifting of the book from ወርቄ ኃይለ ማርያም, and his wife, ትውክ[ል]ተ ሚካኤል, to Saint Rufa'el [church]. He bought the book for 84 birr and gave it to the church. Finally, there is a curse on anyone who steals or erases the book.
